definition: to appear before (one's eyes)/to come to (one's mind)
to reflect (light)/to shine/to project (an image onto a screen etc)
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
(idiom) to greet the eye/to come into view
to come to mind/to come to one's attention

sentences.english: The sight that met my eyes made it hard to keep a straight face.
sentences.chinese: 映入眼簾的情景使我難以板起面孔。

sentences.english: The first thing to catch your sight is the neatly arranged desks in the middle.
sentences.chinese: 首先映入眼簾的是中間排列整齊的書桌。

sentences.english: As soon as you enter in Wuhan, the greenery catches your eye.
sentences.chinese: 當你來到武漢，映入眼簾的是青枝綠葉。

sentences.english: Early in the morning, the flavor of the sun ran into the nasal cavity, graceful posture in atrium.
sentences.chinese: 清晨，陽光的味道撲進鼻腔，曼妙的姿態映入心房。

sentences.english: After two hours the Great Wall appeared before our eyes.
sentences.chinese: 兩小時後，長城映入我們的眼簾。

sentences.english: a huge and unusual crystal chandelier will immediately catch your eye.
sentences.chinese: 一個與衆不同的巨型水晶吊燈立馬就映入你的眼簾。

sentences.english: And all will turn to silver glass.
sentences.chinese: 所有的一切將會映入銀鏡。

sentences.english: A sight that might have been from a 1,000 years ago greeted our eyes.
sentences.chinese: 一道也許是來自千年前的視線，映入我們的眼簾。

sentences.english: Hardly had I got to Elland Road, when the stadium came into my vision.
sentences.chinese: 剛一踏上埃蘭路，不遠處的球場就映入眼簾。

sentences.english: He overlooked the land， which was still a vast expanse of whiteness. Suddenly， a leaden object jumped into his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 突然，一個深灰色的物體映入眼簾。

sentences.english: In the vast expanses of the Gobi desert, the straight highway never ends.
sentences.chinese: 茫茫的戈壁映入眼簾，與天相接與地同廣。

sentences.english: Therefore the whole text may not into the brain, word for word.
sentences.chinese: 因此可以把整段的文字映入大腦，不必逐字逐句過目。

sentences.english: The tall stairway is the first identification space when entering the L house.
sentences.chinese: 當你進入到L住宅時，通高的樓梯空間首先映入眼簾。

sentences.english: The light fragrance strikes, on Shannon south line, a pool of water view.
sentences.chinese: 淡淡的花香襲來，循香南行，一池清水映入眼簾。

sentences.english: The banner headline leaped out at me from the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 報紙上的通欄標題躍然映入我的眼簾。

sentences.english: The last thing she saw was the glint of the axe blade in the eerie, incandescent light.
sentences.chinese: 最後映入她眼簾的就是斧頭刃閃耀着的陰森白光。

definition: eyes (in literature)/eyesight
(idiom) to greet the eye/to come into view
to appear before one's eyes/pleasing to the eye/nice to look at
at present/nowadays
with astonishment/with a shock/awe-inspiringly/impressively/furiously (angry)
to appear before one's eyes/to come into view/to float into appearance/to come back (of images from the past)/to emerge/it emerges/it occurs (to me that..)
to espy/to spot
to flash/to sparkle/to appear suddenly
wide and open/a flash of understanding
before one's eyes/now/at present
eye-catching/conspicuous/obtrusive/striking/sticking out
to stare at
misty
to open (one's eyes)
to flash through (one's mind)/to dodge (away from pursuers)
to flit across/to sweep past/to glance (strike at an angle)
